children.title: How many users are expected to use the solution?
children.context: The number of expected hourly, daily, monthly users is a good indicator for later requirements in regards to scalability and others.

children.title: Is the solution accessed from users in a specific geographic region?
children.context: Solutions with users from various geographical regions have other requirements in regards to latency and availability.

children.title: Is the solution backend hosted on a cloud platform like Azure?
Does the solution have dependencies to any on-premises systems?
children.context: Solutions with dependencies to on-premises systems might have specific requirements in regards to connectivity via e.g. VPN or Express Route.

title: Is the current solution able to scale?
context: Scalability is a key aspect to fulfill increasing usage while maintaining a consistent user experience.
recommendation: Teams Apps should be designed from the beginning to be able to scale in and out easily based on changing demand.

children.title: Is the solution separated into separate components that can scale individually?
children.context: Separate components of an application might have different requirements in regards to scalability, state and lifecycle.
children.recommendation: Separate larger solutions into smaller, microservice-like components that can scale individually.

title: How is the solution and its components monitored?

children.title: Are critical system flows within the solution monitored?

title: How are changes and features rolled out?

children.title: Is it possible to test changes in a production-like environment first?
